entry.title: The Pensions (2005 Order) (Code of Practice) (Material Detriment Test) (Appointed Day) Order (Northern Ireland) 2009
entry.summary: This Order appoints the day for the purposes of Article 86(7) of the Pensions (Northern Ireland) Order 2005 for the coming into operation of the Pensions Regulator Code of practice No. 12: Circumstances in relation to the material detriment test as 29th June 2009.

entry.title: The Pensions Act 2004 (Commencement No.6, Transitional Provisions and Savings) (Amendment) Order 2009
entry.summary: This Order amends the Pensions Act (Commencement No. 6, Transitional Provisions and Savings) Order 2005 (S.I. 2005/1720) (the “Commencement Order”).

entry.title: The Pensions (2008 No. 2 Act) (Commencement No. 3) Order (Northern Ireland) 2009
entry.summary: This Order brings into operation the following provisions of the Pensions (No. 2) Act (Northern Ireland) 2008, relating to contribution notices and financial support directions, on 29th June 2009—

entry.title: The Human Fertilisation and Embryology (Statutory Storage Period for Embryos and Gametes) Regulations 2009
entry.summary: These Regulations provide for embryos and gametes to be stored in certain circumstances for longer than the period of 10 years laid down by section 14(3) and (4) of the Human Fertilisation and Embryology Act 1990 (“the 1990 Act”) as amended by the Human Fertilisation and Embryology Act 2008.

title.div: The Swine Vesicular Disease (Wales) (Amendment) Regulations 2009 / Rheoliadau Clefyd Pothellog y Moch (Cymru) (Diwygio) 2009

div.p: These Regulations amend The Swine Vesicular Disease (Wales) Regulations 2009 (S.I. 2009/1372 (W.135) (“the Principal Regulations”) which implement in Wales the provisions of Council Directive 92/119/EEC introducing general Community measures for the control of certain animal diseases and specific measures relating to swine vesicular disease (OJ No. L 62, 15.3.1993, p. 69) in so far as that Directive controls swine vesicular disease and Council Directive 2007/10/EC (OJ No. L 63, 1.3.2007, p. 24).

Mae'r Rheoliadau hyn yn diwygio Rheoliadau Clefyd Pothellog y Moch (Cymru) 2009 (O.S. 2009/1372 (Cy.135) (“y Prif Reoliadau”) sy'n rhoi ar waith yng Nghymru ddarpariaethau Cyfarwyddeb y Cyngor 92/119/EEC sy'n cyflwyno mesurau Cymunedol cyffredinol i reoli rhai clefydau anifeiliaid a mesurau penodol ynghylch clefyd pothellog y moch (OJ Rhif L 62, 15.3.1993, t. 69) i'r graddau y mae'r Gyfarwyddeb honno'n rheoli clefyd pothellog y moch a Chyfarwyddeb y Cyngor 2007/10/EC (OJ Rhif L 63, 1.3.2007, t.24).

entry.title: The Management of Offenders etc. (Scotland) Act 2005 (Commencement No. 7) Order 2009
entry.summary: Article2 of this Order brings into force section10(2)(b) for the purposes of section10(1)(e) of the Management of Offenders etc. (Scotland) Act 2005 (“the 2005 Act”) in so far as that section relates to certain persons.

entry.title: The Rehabilitation of Offenders Act 1974 (Exclusions and Exceptions) (Scotland) Amendment Order 2009

ukm:Supersedes.dc:title: The Rehabilitation of Offenders Act 1974 (Exclusions and Exceptions) (Scotland) Amendment Order 2009

entry.summary: This Order amends the Rehabilitation of Offenders Act 1974 (Exclusions and Exceptions) (Scotland) Order 2003 (‘the principal order’), which makes exceptions to the provisions of section4 (effect of rehabilitation) of the Rehabilitation of Offenders Act 1974 (the Act). The principal order excludes further proceedings and types of work from certain provisions within that section. This order amends Schedule 4 of the principal order to provide that a post in a social care service involving one to one work with adults at risk is excepted from section4(2)(a), (b) and 4(3)(b) of the Act which relates to the effect of a spent conviction on grounds of dismissal and exclusion of persons from certain types of work.

entry.title: The Working Time (Amendment) Regulations 2009
entry.summary: These Regulations implement the third subparagraph of Article 17(5) of Directive 2003/88/EC of the European Parliament and of the Council of 4 November 2003 concerning certain aspects of the organisation of working time (OJ No. L299, 18.11.2003, p. 9).

entry.title: The Adoption and Children (Scotland) Act 2007 (Commencement No. 4, Transitional and Savings Provisions) Order 2009
entry.summary: This Order is the fourth Commencement Order made under the Adoption and Children (Scotland) Act 2007 (“the Act”). It also makes transitional and savings provisions.

entry.title: The Meat (Official Controls Charges) Regulations (Northern Ireland) 2009
entry.summary: These Regulations revoke and replace the Meat (Official Controls Charges) Regulations (Northern Ireland) 2008 (S.R. 2008 No. 89).

entry.title: The Pensions Act 2004 (Code of Practice) (Material Detriment Test) Appointed Day Order 2009
entry.summary: This Order appoints 29th June 2009 as the day for the coming into effect of the Pensions Regulator Code of Practice No.12: Circumstances in relation to the material detriment test.

entry.title: The Pension Protection Fund (Entry Rules) (Amendment) Regulations (Northern Ireland) 2009
entry.summary: These Regulations prescribe the relevant person’s powers in respect of amending the scheme rules as a matter for the purposes of Article 118(2) of the Pensions (Northern Ireland) Order 2005 (“the Order”). Article 118(2) allows the Board of the Pension Protection Fund, with a view to ensuring that the scheme’s protected liabilities do not exceed its assets, or if they do, that the excess is kept to a minimum, to give directions regarding the exercise, during the assessment period, of the relevant person’s powers in respect of specified matters and such other matters as may be prescribed.

entry.title: The Mid Yorkshire Hospitals National Health Service Trust (Establishment) Amendment Order 2009
entry.summary: This Order amends the Mid Yorkshire Hospitals National Health Service Trust (Establishment) and the Pinderfields and Pontefract Hospitals National Health Service Trust and the Dewsbury Health Care National Health Service Trust (Dissolution) Order 2002 (“the Establishment Order”), which established the Mid Yorkshire Hospitals National Health Service Trust.

entry.title: The Pensions Act 2008 (Commencement No. 4) Order 2009
entry.summary: This Order brings into force provisions in the Pension Act 2008 (c.30) (the “Act”) on 29th June 2009 and 1st July 2009. The provisions brought into force on 29th June 2009 concern amendments of the Pensions Act 2004 relating to contribution notices and financial support directions. The provision brought into force on 1st July 2009 concerns the review of certain aspects of a scheme established under section 67 of the Act.

entry.title: The Education (Student Support) (European Institutions) (Amendment) Regulations 2009
entry.summary: These Regulations amend the Education (Student Support) (European Institutions) (No 2) Regulations 2006 (“the Principal Regulations”) and the Education (Student Support) (European Institutions) (Amendment) (No. 2) Regulations 2008 (“the 2008 Regulations”). The Principal Regulations provide for support for eligible students taking designated higher education courses at Bologna Center, the College of Europe or the European University Institute in respect of an academic year beginning on or after 1st September 2007. The Schedule to the 2008 Regulations sets out the increase in the amounts of support payable to eligible students for the academic years beginning on or after 1st September 2009. These Regulations, the Principal Regulations and the 2008 Regulations apply to England only.

entry.title: The Cotswolds Area of Outstanding Natural Beauty (Establishment of Conservation Board) (Amendment) Order 2009

ukm:Supersedes.dc:title: The Cotswolds Area of Outstanding Natural Beauty (Establishment of Conservation Board) (Amendment) Order 2009

entry.summary: This Order amends the Cotswolds Area of Outstanding Natural Beauty (Establishment of Conservation Board) Order 2004 (S.I. 2004/1777) so as to apply regulation 30 (retirement benefits) of the Local Authorities (Capital Finance and Accounting) (England) Regulations 2003 (S.I. 2003/3146) to the Board. This will allow the Board, when compiling its annual statement of accounts, to reverse the effect of Financial Reporting Standard 17 (retirement benefits) issued by the Accounting Standards Board (November 2000) in respect of pension fund adjustments, as local authorities may, by virtue of that regulation. Financial Reporting Standard 17 requires the Board’s pension fund to provide for the possibility of all members of its staff being made redundant at the same time and all taking their pension entitlement at that time, and the making of a corresponding entry in the Board’s revenue account. By virtue of this Order, the Board must charge to its revenue account an amount equal to the retirement benefits payments and contributions to pension funds which are payable for the financial year in question in accordance with the Local Government Pension Scheme Regulations 1997 (S.I. 1997/1612).

entry.title: Water Supply (Water Quality) (Amendment) Regulations (Northern Ireland) 2009
entry.summary: These Regulations amend the Water Supply (Water Quality) Regulations (Northern Ireland) 2007 (S.R. 2007/147) (“the Principal Regulations). The Principal Regulations implement Council Directive 98/83/EC on the quality of water intended for human consumption (“the Drinking Water Directive”) (OJ No L330, 5.12.1998, p.32) in Northern Ireland in relation of water supplies by water undertakers, and make further provision about the supply of drinking water. These amendment Regulations also implement parts of Council Directive 2000/60/EC (“the Water Framework Directive”) and Council Directive 2008/99/EC (“the Environmental Crime Directive”).

title.div: The Local Health Boards (Transfer of Staff, Property, Rights and Liabilities) (Wales) Order 2009 / Gorchymyn y Byrddau Iechyd Lleol (Trosglwyddo Staff, Eiddo, Hawliau a Rhwymedigaethau) (Cymru) 2009

div.p: This Order provides for the transfer on 1 October 2009 of staff, property, rights and liabilities from the Local Health Boards dissolved by the Local Health Boards (Establishment and Dissolution) (Wales) Order 2009 ( S.I. 2009/ 778 (W.66)) to the new Local Health Boards established on 1 June 2009 by that Order.

Mae'r Gorchymyn hwn yn darparu ar gyfer trosglwyddo staff, eiddo, hawliau a rhwymedigaethau ar 1 Hydref 2009 oddi wrth y Byrddau Iechyd Lleol a ddiddymwyd gan Orchymyn y Byrddau Iechyd Lleol (Sefydlu a Diddymu) (Cymru) 2009 (O.S. 2009/ 778 (Cy.66)) i'r Byrddau Iechyd Lleol newydd a sefydlwyd ar 1 Mehefin 2008 gan y Gorchymyn hwnnw.

title.div: The National Health Service Trusts (Transfer of Staff, Property, Rights and Liabilities) (Wales) Order 2009 / Gorchymyn Ymddiriedolaethau'r Gwasanaeth Iechyd Gwladol (Trosglwyddo Staff, Eiddo, Hawliau a Rhwymedigaethau) (Cymru) 2009

div.p: This Order provides for the transfer on 1 October 2009 of staff, property, rights and liabilities from the National Health Service Trusts dissolved by the National Health Service Trusts (Dissolution) (Wales) Order (S.I. 2009/1306 (W. 117)) to the new Local Health Boards established by the Local Health Boards (Establishment and Dissolution) (Wales) Order 2009 ( S.I. 2009/ 778 (W.66)).

Mae'r Gorchymyn hwn yn darparu ar gyfer trosglwyddo ar 1 Hydref 2009 staff, eiddo, hawliau a rhwymedigaethau o Ymddiriedolaethau'r Gwasanaeth Iechyd Gwladol a ddiddymwyd gan Orchymyn Ymddiriedolaethau'r Gwasanaeth Iechyd Gwladol (Diddymu) (Cymru) (O.S. 2009/1306 (Cy.117)) i'r Byrddau Iechyd Lleol newydd a sefydlwyd gan Orchymyn Byrddau Iechyd Lleol (Sefydlu a Diddymu) (Cymru) 2009 (O.S. 2009/778 (Cy. 66)).

entry.title: The Social Security (Students and Miscellaneous Amendments) Regulations 2009
entry.summary: These Regulations amend a number of different regulations relating to social security.
